name: Direct-to-Consumer eCommerce Platform for Global Pharmaceutical Company
description: Built a comprehensive direct-to-consumer eCommerce platform for a global pharmaceutical company's diabetes care products across EU markets, featuring automated insurance processing and GDPR compliance, processing 2000+ daily orders for 1.5 million users.
challenge: A global pharmaceutical giant needed to establish a direct-to-consumer sales channel for their flagship diabetes care products in EU markets, eliminating distribution margins while providing complex health insurance reimbursements according to country-specific laws. The platform required GDPR compliance, PCI-DSS certification, and support for older patients through offline ordering capabilities.
solution: Designed and implemented a scalable eCommerce platform with multiple payment methods and country-specific reimbursement systems, SAP integration for warehouse and financial management, machine learning algorithms for personalized pricing, exclusive sub-stores for multiple brands, subscription management, GDPR compliance features, PCI-DSS certified infrastructure, and offline ordering capabilities for elderly patients.
outcomes: 2000+ orders processed daily for 1.5 million users
Offline ordering feature ensuring high adoption among older patients
500+ hours of manual work saved monthly through automated insurance processing
Full GDPR and PCI-DSS compliance across EU markets
Significant improvement in customer satisfaction and retention
teamSize: Large cross-functional team including compliance specialists
keyFeatures: Multi-payment method support with country-specific processing
SAP integration for warehouse management and accounting
Multi-brand exclusive sub-stores within single platform
Subscription ordering with simultaneous prescription tabs
Cash pay and reimbursement order dual support
GDPR compliance with consent management and opt-in/out features
Offline ordering capabilities for elderly patient accessibility
